title: What is the size of the remaining sides and angles of a right triangle ABC if it is given: b = 10 cm; c = 20 cm; angle alpha = 60° and the angle beta = 30°? - Quora

response.answer_text: What is the size of the remaining sides and angles of a right triangle ABC if it is given: b = 10 cm; c = 20 cm; angle alpha = 60° and the angle beta = 30°? If Angle alpha is 60 Degrees and angle beta is 30 Degrees then the remaining angle gamma is 90 Degrees and the remaining side c is 10*sqrt(3) cm.
Angles : A = 60° , B = 30° , C = 90° Sine of Angles: A = √3 / 2 , B = 1 / 2 , C = 1 Sides : a = 10 √3 cm , b = 10 cm , c = 20 cm
